posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
Hi all,

Are Divine Might/Shield worth taking ?

It has always seemed to me to be a heavy investment in terms of feats, and pumping Cha for limited short term buffs.

Thoughts ?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
As limited short term buffs, no. 

I usually use the base 18-20 CHA as a metric to help decide if it is worth it.  You'll need to take the environment's max item property level into account as well.  Once you are able to elevate that intrinsic CHA up to 30 or more via buffs/items near to the cap, the benefits are more noticeable.  Of course, the CHA mod also determines the number of uses and duration as well.

These buffs are dispelled according to character level rather than caster level so are fairly sturdy.  No concentration check or AoO possible.

Are there rest restrictions within the environment which would make it a problem in long dungeon crawls, like a caster would have?

Exalted Sorcerers(esses) i.e. sorc pally:  DvS is a natural synergy.   Also, bardic priests can find a handy synergy, as can CoT's little used Divine Wrath.

Just bear in mind that Divine Might does nothing to help AB so will need to share ability distribution with the primary attack ability (STR/DEX/WIS) for physical combat prowess.  If you cannot hit the targets reliably, the durations will time out and that awe-inspiring damage is not realized.  That is the main equalizer with DivMight, balancing an effective AB vs. the potential benefits of elevating CHA to add divine damage.

Another consideration is whether it is worthwhile to allocate 13 points to STR and PA (which you have already skirted).  Also, do Cleric/Pally/BG classes fit in well with your goals?  That can only be reckoned on a build-by-build basis because there are too many variables to consider.  It is very tough to build a finessing DW toon with Divine buffs and still maintain an effective attack.

Rather than dealing in hypotheticals, if you have a particular situation in mind, share.  It is easier to make a build-specific recommendation than make an assessment about a generalization.

posts.content: Short answer: Only in the builds that already have Charisma in there.
